unicode.value: Investigant la física amb els REDO del projecte EDIA
Comunicació escrita per a les jornades organitzades pel CEFIRE i el CEDEC en Calp. Siutacions d'aprenentatge del projecte EDIA

Hello, my name is Aurora Marco. I studied Chemistry, Biochemistry and in Food Science and Technology in the University of Valencia. I completed my PhD at the Institute of Agrochemistry and Food Technology of the Spanish Spanish National Research Council  (CSIC).

Since 2018, I have been working as a Physics and Chemistry teacher at IES Enric Soler i Godes in Benifaió. I am passionate about integrating digital tools into education and promoting active learning methodologies in the classroom.

My school is a small institution that was built in 1983 to accommodate 300 students, but it now serves over 500. We offer compulsory secondary education (ESO), starting with five classes and ending with two, as well as baccalaureate programs and learning improvement initiatives. Additionally, we provide basic, intermediate, and advanced computer training courses. Unfortunately, there have been no improvements to the infrastructure since the school was established. For nearly 20 years, we have relied on temporary classrooms, known as 'barracks,' and until 2023, we did not have Wi-Fi installed. Our school also lacks an elevator, and we have only two computer rooms available for all ESO groups. Recently, laboratories and departmental spaces have been converted into classrooms.

In the shool, we have a driving team committed to and passionate about teaching. This group is characterized by its constant collaboration, where each member contributes their experience and knowledge to enrich the learning environment. Together, we share teaching strategies and resources, allowing us to enhance our students' educational experience. Open communication and mutual support are fundamental in our daily work, helping us tackle the challenges that arise. We strive to create an inclusive and motivating environment that promotes the overall development of our students.
Situacions d'aprenentatge EDIA per a Física i Química en 2º d'ESO

Faced with the lack of a IT classroom at the center, we thought a mobile computer room was needed. As a solution, a charging cabinet with capacity for 24 laptops, which could be brought to the classroom when needed was purchased and in the recent past our school was fited with WIFI acces in all the classrooms.  We must thank the management team for providing us with all the necessary equipment, as well as hours of co-teaching for each group.

The external website iDevice loads an external website into an inline frame in your eXe content rather then opening it in a popup box. This means learners are not having to juggle windows. This iDevice should only be used if your content will be viewed by learners online.
Enter the URL you wish to display and select the size of the area to display it in.

Technovation Girls 2020

In this project, students learned how to program a mobile app from scratch to calculate the carbon footprint of everyday activities, such as food consumption, transportation, and the use of household appliances. Despite having no prior experience in programming, neither the students nor I, we successfully developed the app. This initiative not only introduced the basics of coding but also aimed to raise awareness about sustainable living by allowing users to track and reduce their carbon emissions based on their daily habits.

Technovation Girls (2021)

In this project, students with no prior programming experience worked on creating a mobile app designed to support individuals with Alzheimer's and their caregivers. The app included features such as GPS tracking for location, a calendar and alarm system for medication reminders, a personal information page in case the person got lost, photo galleries to help with memory, and memory games to stimulate cognitive function. Additionally, the app incorporated a fall detection system that would automatically contact emergency services, providing an essential safety feature for those at risk.

De major vull ser com...

Video for the contest "When I Grow Up, I Want to Be Like..." The video compares the lives of two Spanish scientists: Mª José Fabra (1979) and Mª Teresa Toral (1911).
Unveiling the Cosmic Secrets with the Cloud Chamber

Fira experimenta 2024

Project where three 3rd-year ESO students attempted to build a cloud chamber to observe alpha particles and other types of radiation. Through this project, they explored fundamental concepts in nuclear physics, experimenting with radiation detection and particle observation, while also developing practical skills in constructing scientific equipment. Their goal was to better understand cosmic particles and radioactive phenomena, making complex physics tangible and engaging.

Fira experimenta 2024

In this project, 2nd ESO students studied heat transfer mechanisms and insulating materials with the goal of building shelters for penguins. At the same time, they aimed to raise awareness about the importance of improving thermal insulation in homes to increase energy efficiency. Through this activity, they combined scientific experimentation with reflection on environmental impact, linking physics to real-world challenges such as energy savings and sustainability.

• Adaptación del REA «Investigando la actividad científica» en el IES Enric Soler i Godes de Benifaió
  • Enriqueciendo las clases de física y química con los REA del proyecto EDIA (I). Investigando el movimiento
  • Enriqueciendo las clases de física y química con los REA del proyecto EDIA (II). Investigando las fuerzas
  • Enriqueciendo las clases de física y química con los REA del proyecto EDIA (III). Investigando la energía
  • Introducción a la Física mediante la aplicación de los REA del proyecto EDIA
  • Investigando el movimiento: un viaje desde 2º a 4º de la ESO
